thread.title: White Ferns win with last over Anna Peterson hat-trick
thread.title_full: White Ferns win with last over Anna Peterson hat-trick

author: Logan Savory
title: White Ferns win with last over Anna Peterson hat-trick
text:
White Ferns win with last over Anna Peterson hat-trick LOGAN SAVORY Last updated 20:12, February 19 2017 SKY SPORT 
Anna Peterson scores first White Ferns hat-trick in win over Australia. 
A last over hat-trick from Anna Peterson has helped the White Ferns to a twenty20 victory over Australia in Geelong. 
Peterson has become the first New Zealand female cricketer to take an international twenty20 hat-trick, and just the fourth in the history of international womens twenty20 cricket. 
The New Zealand women's cricket team were coming off a hammering in the first game of the series on Friday and didn't start all well in game two. Scott Barbour 
Anna Peterson has taken a hat-trick to help the White Ferns to a twenty20 win over Australia. 
They lost the toss and were sent in by Australia and could only manage to squeeze out 101-9 from their 20 overs. 
That is despite Suzie Bates (30) and Rachel Priest (20) putting on 38 for first wicket inside the first six overs.
